alert.note: Alert for Columbia; McDuffie (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:31PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern McDuffie, southern Columbia, northwestern Burke and southwestern Richmond Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 431 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Warrenton to 6 miles southwest of Harlem to 6 miles southwest of Fort Gordon. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Hephzibah, McBean, Blythe, Keysville, Leitner Lake Conference Center, Adamsville, Bath-Edie, Pea Patch Aerodrome, Autney, Shell Bluff, Ellwood and Diamond Lakes Regional Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
